comments.body:
Still too complicated...

You fill the deleted virtual server back after deleting just because you have trouble in the for loop?

I would suggest:

1. copy rss to a new slice, e.g. rssToDelete

2. 
```
for i := range rssToDelete {
  delete rss[i]
  check the number of elements from rss
}
```

Would it work for you?

Actually, I do this also for test delete first/last/middle element in the list.
Cause maybe the function delete an element that not we wanted, then check the number not work. And also have the possible that the special position of the list can't be delete, such as the last one, in the previous case.
But if you think the test is too specific, keep it simple also make sense for me, I guess.

> Cause maybe the function delete an element that not we wanted, then check the number not work. 

I feel like checking the remained number of elements is enough.
After all, it's a fake implementation.
That's true, let's keep it simpler.
